bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Lunsford D. Fricks, May 22, 1919

div1.p: Carter writes that Mayne should supervise the packing of his laboratory equipment for transport.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Lunsford D. Fricks, May 22, 1919
div1.opener:
/LC
Baltimore, Md.,
May 22, 1919.
Surgeon Lunsford D. Fricks,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C. (Please forward)
Dear Doctor Fricks:
div1.p:
When you move Mayne's laboratory from New Orleans it will
be absolutely necessary for him to go down and superintend pack-
ing. Unless this be done (1) there will be a good deal of break-
age and (2) you will never be able to find half of the things.
There are articles there of considerable value.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, Assistant Surgeon General.
